snippet: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration reported a concern that jostling the key could accidentally turn off the engine and disable the air bags on 1.2 million vehicles.
abstract: Federal regulators disclose that they are conducting review of all major automakers for ignition-switch problems similar to safety defect that General Motors has linked to at least 13 deaths; review, led by National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, has tuned up potential problems at Chrysler so far, and agency has opened investigation into about 1.2 million of their vehicles.

byline.original: By HILARY STOUT and CHRISTOPHER JENSEN

lead_paragraph: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration reported a concern that jostling the key could accidentally turn off the engine and disable the air bags on 1.2 million vehicles.

headline.main: U.S. Opens Safety Review of Chryslers
headline.print_headline: U.S. Opens Safety Review of Chryslers
